items.title: Trump says Iran leadership agrees to talks after US and Israel strike Tehran
items.standfirst: ‘They should have done it sooner, they waited too long,’ says Trump but he doesn’t say when talks would take placeUS-Israel war on Iran – latest updatesSign up for the Breaking News US emailDonald Trump said on Sunday that Iran’s political leadership have agreed to talks, a day after the US and Israel began to target the country’s military and political infrastructure, killing the supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei and several top officials.“They want to talk, and I have agreed to talk, so I will be talking to them,” Trump told a reporter for the Atlantic magazine on Sunday. “They should have done it sooner. They should have given what was very practical and easy to do sooner. They waited too long.”Reuters contributed reporting Continue reading...
items.content: ‘They should have done it sooner, they waited too long,’ says Trump but he doesn’t say when talks would take placeUS-Israel war on Iran – latest updatesSign up for the Breaking News US emailDonald Trump said on Sunday that Iran’s political leadership have agreed to talks, a day after the US and Israel began to target the country’s military and political infrastructure, killing the supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei and several top officials.“They want to talk, and I have agreed to talk, so I will be talking to them,” Trump told a reporter for the Atlantic magazine on Sunday. “They should have done it sooner. They should have given what was very practical and easy to do sooner. They waited too long.”Reuters contributed reporting Continue reading...

items.title: Trump says U.S. sunk 9 Iranian naval ships in latest update on military operation
items.standfirst: President Trump announced Sunday on social media that the U.S. "destroyed and sunk 9 Iranian Naval Ships" as the massive military operation in Iran that began Saturday continues. CBS News White House correspondent Willie James Inman has more.
items.content: President Trump announced Sunday on social media that the U.S. "destroyed and sunk 9 Iranian Naval Ships" as the massive military operation in Iran that began Saturday continues. CBS News White House correspondent Willie James Inman has more.

items.title: CIA intelligence led to strike that killed Khamenei in Iran, source says
items.standfirst: The CIA had tracked Khamenei's location for several months before the strike that killed him, a person familiar with the matter tells CBS News.
items.content: The CIA had tracked Khamenei's location for several months before the strike that killed him, a person familiar with the matter tells CBS News.

items.title: CIA intelligence led to missile strike that killed Iran's supreme leader, source says

items.content: CIA intelligence led to the missile strike that killed Iran's supreme leader and other senior Iranian officials on Saturday, a source says. Olivia Gazis has more details.

items.title: Mourning and celebration after the death of Iran's Supreme Leader
items.standfirst: The world greeted with jubilation, anger or trepidation the news Sunday that Iran's supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei had been killed in the US-Israeli strikes on the Islamic republic one day earlier.
items.content: The world greeted with jubilation, anger or trepidation the news Sunday that Iran's supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei had been killed in the US-Israeli strikes on the Islamic republic one day earlier.

items.title: After Khamenei, who rules Iran?

items.content: Under fire from US and Israeli jets, the Islamic republic’s leaders turn to succession

items.title: Sen. Tom Cotton says "not a simple answer" as to who will lead Iran now
items.standfirst: Sen. Tom Cotton, the chairman of the Senate Intelligence Committee, said after the killing of Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei in the U.S.-Israeli military operation, there's "not a simple answer" as to who will lead the Iranian people.
items.content: Sen. Tom Cotton, the chairman of the Senate Intelligence Committee, said after the killing of Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei in the U.S.-Israeli military operation, there's "not a simple answer" as to who will lead the Iranian people.

items.title: Dubai influencers stunned by Iranian strikes
items.standfirst: Influencers gone to Dubai for its luxurious lifestyle are now watching, helpless and sometimes shocked, as Iran attacks the Gulf countries, retaliating against the large-scale Israeli-American air strikes operation that killed Supreme Leader Ayatollah Al Khamenei. Since Saturday, many expatriates in the United Arab Emirates have been sharing videos of plumes of smoke rising above skyscrapers.
items.content: Influencers gone to Dubai for its luxurious lifestyle are now watching, helpless and sometimes shocked, as Iran attacks the Gulf countries, retaliating against the large-scale Israeli-American air strikes operation that killed Supreme Leader Ayatollah Al Khamenei. Since Saturday, many expatriates in the United Arab Emirates have been sharing videos of plumes of smoke rising above skyscrapers.

items.title: Sen. Tom Cotton says "not a simple answer" as to who will lead Iran now
items.standfirst: "There's probably a lot of jockeying inside of Iran right now, they have a very consultative, deliberative process to replace the Supreme Leader," Sen. Tom Cotton said Sunday on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan."
items.content: "There's probably a lot of jockeying inside of Iran right now, they have a very consultative, deliberative process to replace the Supreme Leader," Sen. Tom Cotton said Sunday on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan."

items.title: Who are the council members temporarily in charge of Iran?
items.standfirst: Until Khamenei's successor is picked, three-member leadership council, including Ayatollah Arafi, will lead Iran.
items.content: Until Khamenei's successor is picked, three-member leadership council, including Ayatollah Arafi, will lead Iran.

items.title: Penny Wong backs Israeli and US strikes on Iran as Labor group decries ‘sycophantic capitulation to militarism’
items.standfirst: Australian foreign affairs minister says Israel and US should explain ‘the legal basis for the attacks’ on Iran and won’t say if Pine Gap used during strikesFollow our Australia news live blog for latest updatesGet our breaking news email, free app or daily news podcastAustralia has urged Iran to stop retaliatory attacks on countries across the Middle East after the US and Israel bombed Iran, killing its supreme leader, Ali Khamenei.The foreign affairs minister, Penny Wong, when asked about the legality of the strikes on Iran, said it was up to Australia’s allies to explain “the legal basis”. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump tells NBC a “large amount” of Iran’s leadership is gone
items.standfirst: In a phone call today, President Trump said strikes in Iran have caused "very great losses on their leadership," and that "tremendous damage has been inflicted.” He told NBC News’ Kristen Welker he already thinks the operation is “a success.”
items.content: In a phone call today, President Trump said strikes in Iran have caused "very great losses on their leadership," and that "tremendous damage has been inflicted.” He told NBC News’ Kristen Welker he already thinks the operation is “a success.”

items.title: Iran's hard-line supreme leader is dead after major military strikes, Trump says

items.content: President Donald Trump announced that Iran’s supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, was killed on Saturday after the U.S. and Israel launched a predawn assault.

items.title: The death of Iran's Ayatollah Khamenei ends decades of paranoia-fuelled absolute power
items.standfirst: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei ruled Iran for decades, fuelled by paranoia, absolute power and a belief in his own divine destiny.
items.content: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei ruled Iran for decades, fuelled by paranoia, absolute power and a belief in his own divine destiny.

items.title: How have Iranians reacted to death of supreme leader?
items.standfirst: Iranians have been seen taking to the streets to react to the death of supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, in video clips that began to emerge after the attack on Saturday.
items.content: Iranians have been seen taking to the streets to react to the death of supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, in video clips that began to emerge after the attack on Saturday.

items.title: Iran's Ayatollah Ali Khamenei is killed in Israeli strike, ending 36-year iron rule
items.standfirst: Khamenei, the Islamic Republic's second supreme leader, has been killed. He had held power since 1989, guiding Iran through difficult times — and overseeing the violent suppression of dissent.
items.content: Khamenei, the Islamic Republic's second supreme leader, has been killed. He had held power since 1989, guiding Iran through difficult times — and overseeing the violent suppression of dissent.(Image credit: Atta Kenare)

items.title: Trump says 'a large amount' of Iran's leadership is gone

items.content: President Donald Trump said Saturday that U.S. and Israeli strikes on Iran killed Ayatollah Ali Khamenei and other top leaders.

items.title: What to know about the U.S. and Israeli attacks on Iran
items.standfirst: Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei was killed in Israeli airstrikes with U.S. support on Saturday. "Operation Epic Fury" will be "massive and ongoing," President Trump said.
items.content: Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei was killed in Israeli airstrikes with U.S. support on Saturday. "Operation Epic Fury" will be "massive and ongoing," President Trump said.(Image credit: AP)

clusters.title: At least 22 people dead after pro-Iran protests in Pakistan and Iraq
clusters.neutral_headline: At least 22 people dead after pro-Iran protests in Pakistan and Iraq
bullet_summary: Reported by Guardian World, France24

items.title: At least 22 people dead after pro-Iran protests in Pakistan and Iraq
items.standfirst: US government buildings in Karachi and Baghdad targeted by crowds after killing of Ayatollah Ali KhameneiAt least 22 people are dead following pro-Iran demonstrations in Pakistan that have seen hundreds of people march on the US consulate in Karachi. Security forces in Iraq have also fired teargas at protesters who tried to storm the US embassy in Baghdad.As anger boiled over after US-Israeli strikes killed Iran’s supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, a crowd of demonstrators in Karachi chanted against the offensive before entering the reception hall of the consulate building and lighting a small fire. Continue reading...
items.content: US government buildings in Karachi and Baghdad targeted by crowds after killing of Ayatollah Ali KhameneiAt least 22 people are dead following pro-Iran demonstrations in Pakistan that have seen hundreds of people march on the US consulate in Karachi. Security forces in Iraq have also fired teargas at protesters who tried to storm the US embassy in Baghdad.As anger boiled over after US-Israeli strikes killed Iran’s supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, a crowd of demonstrators in Karachi chanted against the offensive before entering the reception hall of the consulate building and lighting a small fire. Continue reading...

items.title: Death of Ali Khamenei : Pro-Iranian regime protesters attack US consulates
items.standfirst: On Sunday in Karachi, at least nine protesters were killed during violent clashes outside the US consulate. The protesters rallied after US and Israeli strikes in Iran led to the death of Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei, and attempted to force their way into the diplomatic compound. Police responded with gunfire and tear gas to disperse the crowd. The violence spread to other Pakistani cities where rallies also turned violent. Security around US diplomatic sites has been tightened.
items.content: On Sunday in Karachi, at least nine protesters were killed during violent clashes outside the US consulate. The protesters rallied after US and Israeli strikes in Iran led to the death of Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei, and attempted to force their way into the diplomatic compound. Police responded with gunfire and tear gas to disperse the crowd. The violence spread to other Pakistani cities where rallies also turned violent. Security around US diplomatic sites has been tightened.

clusters.title: UK personnel just 200 metres away from Iranian missile strike
clusters.neutral_headline: UK personnel just 200 metres away from Iranian missile strike
bullet_summary: No casualties were reported
Reported by Guardian World, BBC Top Stories

items.title: UK personnel just 200 metres away from Iranian missile strike
items.standfirst: British forces in Bahrain and Iraq being drawn into Iran conflict in defence of civilian sites and military assetsUS-Israeli attack on Iran – live updatesThree hundred British personnel were within 200 metres (650ft) of an Iranian missile and drone strike on the US naval base in Bahrain on Saturday, one of several incidents where UK forces have been drawn into the war in the Middle East.No casualties were reported. The strike was one of more than 25 waves of retaliatory attacks in response to the massive US-Israeli joint bombing campaign launched against Iran on Saturday. Continue reading...

The strike was one of more than 25 waves of retaliatory attacks in response to the massive US-Israeli joint bombing campaign launched against Iran on Saturday. Continue reading...

items.title: Suspected Russian ‘shadow fleet’ tanker seized in North Sea
items.standfirst: Belgian special forces boarded the Ethera, which was sailing under the flag of Guinea, on Saturday nightBelgium has seized an oil tanker believed to form part of the so-called “shadow fleet” used by Russia to circumvent western sanctions over the war in Ukraine.Special forces assisted by French helicopters boarded the ship in a clandestine operation in the North Sea on Saturday night, Belgium’s defence minister, Theo Francken, said on Sunday. bullet_summary: Footage from local media showed people rushing to collect banknotes while police in riot gear tried to disperse them using teargas
Reported by BBC World, Guardian World

items.title: At least 20 killed after military plane carrying banknotes crashes in Bolivia
items.standfirst: Police fire tear gas to disperse crowds allegedly trying to take banknotes from the crash site.
items.content: Police fire tear gas to disperse crowds allegedly trying to take banknotes from the crash site.

items.title: At least 20 killed as cash-laden military cargo plane crashes in Bolivia
items.standfirst: Riot police use teargas to disperse people gathering around wreckage of plane loaded with money from central bankAt least 20 people have died and dozens have been injured after a military cargo plane carrying banknotes crashed while landing near Bolivia’s capital on Friday, damaging about a dozen vehicles on a highway and scattering bills on the ground, an official has said.Footage from local media showed people rushing to collect banknotes while police in riot gear tried to disperse them using teargas. Authorities were later seen setting the money alight in a bonfire at the scene of the crash. Continue reading...
items.content: Riot police use teargas to disperse people gathering around wreckage of plane loaded with money from central bankAt least 20 people have died and dozens have been injured after a military cargo plane carrying banknotes crashed while landing near Bolivia’s capital on Friday, damaging about a dozen vehicles on a highway and scattering bills on the ground, an official has said.Footage from local media showed people rushing to collect banknotes while police in riot gear tried to disperse them using teargas. Authorities were later seen setting the money alight in a bonfire at the scene of the crash. Continue reading...
